message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.SE, cs.CR, cs.SY. 

The paper describes an integrated software tool for reasoning with uncertainty in a naval situation assessment application. This involves correlating reports and tracks, locating and classifying platforms, and identifying intents and threats. The tool uses T-norm based uncertainty calculi to perform inference and has been tested and validated in a sequence of experiments. This suggests that the paper could belong to several arXiv CS sub-categories, including cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) for the use of reasoning and inference, cs.LG (Machine Learning) for the use of uncertainty calculi, cs.SE (Software Engineering) for the description of an integrated software tool, cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) for the use of meta-information to resolve ignorance or conflict, and cs.SY (Systems and Control) for the use of a control layer to select appropriate calculi and resolve conflict.
